King’s Counsel Gary Judd files complaint over tikanga Māori requirement for law students, Winston Peters agrees https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kings-counsel-files-complaint-over-tikanga-maori-requirement-for-law-students/YBZG7EOSARHC3CRYKIYESADMZE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kings-counsel-files-complaint-over-tikanga-maori-requirement-for-law-students/YBZG7EOSARHC3CRYKIYESADMZE/ Katie Harris, Benjamin PlummerKing's Counsel describes incoming requirement as 'symptomatic of a dangerous trend'. Tue, 07 May 2024 07:30:47 +0000 Senior King’s Counsel Gary Judd has filed a complaint to the Government’s Regulations Review Committee over incoming compulsory tikanga Māori studies for law students. Deputy PM Winston Peters has supported this.
